Key Arguments: The bill is unnecessary and redundant as the government already has means to address genuine threats.
The bill is illiberal and contravenes liberal democratic principles and international human rights treaties.
Key terms in the bill such as 'misinformation', 'disinformation', and 'harm' are poorly defined and open to abuse.
The bill lacks transparency in determining what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
The bill could be weaponized against individuals or groups with opposing views to government policy.
Notable Quotes: The bill is entirely redundant, antithetical to the liberal democratic principles on which this country was founded.
The draft Bill directly contravenes the right to freedom of expression.
This draft Bill signals a dangerous turn toward totalitarianism.
